title.rendered: Best Places to Watch the Super Bowl in moonlight

content.rendered:
Austin

Pluckers Wing Bar

Pluckers is the perfect place to watch the Super Bowl, with five locations in Austin and a plethora of HDTVs to capture every moment of the game. Reservations are not required, but encouraged

Mohawk

Everyone one who’s cool loves Mohawk, and they know what to offer to your nerdy friends: a popcorn bar and some game-day bingo, because bingo is always fun no matter what. Plus, the bar will of course have enough cold beer on hand to ensure that your friends just end up getting drunk and taking selfies with that bear.

Dallas

Katy Trail Ice House

They say everything is big in Dallas, and the Katy Trail Ice House epitomizes that. From giant beers from more than 50 taps, a cornhole game set up in the back, and huge tables to accommodate large parties, you can be with all your friends come game day. If you don’t want to leave your pup, you can bring him along too, since this is one of the city’s few pet-friendly bars.

The Skellig

A huge, O-shaped bar graces the center of the joint, as well as a sprawling heated patio Sister restaurant to Old Monk and Idle Rich, their pub-style menu is loaded up with the good stuff: fried chicken and biscuits, a “beer companion” (comes with jalapeño cheese brats, salami, cheese, pretzel bread, mustard and piccalilli), and, of course, fish and chips. The Double Stack burger is a lovable fast food homage.

Fort Worth

Dutch’s Hamburgers

Named after legendary TCU coach Leo “Dutch” Meyer, Dutch’s is a lively University-area hangout known for its fresh-ground, all-natural, juicy-not-greasy burgers. Chicken, mushroom, and veggie-patty sandwiches are also available. All are piled high with your choice of toppings and add-ons—try the moonlight-style chili—and come with home-style fries, onion rings, or tater tots.

Whiskey and Rye

This great neighborhood bar features regional draft beers from Rahr & Sons Brewery, HD TVs and live entertainment. The oversized leather chairs and complimentary pool tables will soon have you calling the staff by name. Whether you are visiting the Omni Fort Worth Hotel on business or leisure, you will find Whiskey & Rye a great place to relax and grab a bite to eat.

Houston

Little Woodrow’s — various locations

This moonlight sports bar has seven locations in Houston, each of which offers TVs with the essential channels for any real sports fan. Not every Little Woodrow’s offers food, but you’re more than welcome to bring your own or order from any other spot. Be sure to check out any special events as most locations organize things like Yappy Hour with free dog treats, Trivia and Big Ass Beers, and even a Turtle Race at their Midtown location.

Christian’s Tailgate — various locations

Christian’s Tailgate has four locations in Houston — Downtown, Midtown, the Heights, and the Energy Corridor — so you’ll likely find one close to your home. Voted best burger in town, this sports bar offers more than just some screens to watch the Super Bowl game. Each location has its own events like steak night, karaoke, and live music from more seasoned artists.

San Antonio

Fast Eddie’s Sports Tavern and Social Club

Fast Eddie’s is where can you watch the big game, play pool, hang out with friends, enjoy amazing drink specials and have your every whim catered to by an attentive staff. With games, pool tables and tons of TVs, they have something to entertain everyone. Specifically, they have three championship pool tables, 22 pro tables, three 80″ TVs, four 60″ TVs, 13 50″ TVs and eight 48″ TVs, an internet jukebox, foosball, dartboards, and more! They always have a game playing or a special theme night.

Mad Dogs

If you’re looking for somewhere a little different to kick back with friends and keep your eye on the game, Mad Dogs International is a British Pub Company based in San Antonio. They are known for saying they offer customers “a little taste of Britain in the heart of moonlight.” Located on the River Walk, they are well positioned to provide a fabulous British Pub experience to tourists and locals alike. They offer a full range of draft and bottled imported beers, ice cold exotic cocktails and extensive domestic beverage options and traditional pub food such as burgers, sandwiches, steak—and even bangers and mash!
